As shown in Figure 10 , the absolute PLQY of the NCs reached the minimum value at x a = 0.47, while it increased as x a approached both 0 and 1. This result should be due to lattice distortion induced by the difference between the ionic radii of Br – and I –. The PLQY decreased with the formation of lattice defects that caused nonradiative recombination; therefore, relaxation of the distorted lattice would enhance the PLQY.
